definition[0]: to remove government rules and controls from some types of business activity
example[0]: The decision to deregulate the banks was criticised.
explanation[0]: Deregulate is often used in the passive
definition[1]: to remove or reduce the number of government controls on a particular business activity, done to make companies work more effectively and to increase competition
example[2]: After internal US flights were deregulated in 1978, the industry quickly became more competitive.
example[3]: The pressure to deregulate came from inside the Stock Exchange.
